answer.answer:
There are a few different ways to add your Monzo card to Apple Pay 💳

- __iPhone__: open the Wallet app and tap the __+__ button
- __Apple Watch__: open the Apple Watch app on your iPhone and tap __Wallet & Apple Pay__, then tap __Add Credit or Debit Card__
- __iPad__: open the Settings app, tap __Wallet & Apple Pay__, then tap __Add Credit or Debit Card__
- __MacBook with Touch ID__: open System Preferences, select __Wallet & Apple Pay__, then click the __Add Card...__ button

If you've just opened your account and didn't set up Apple Pay during signup, you'll need to wait for your card to arrive before you can do it.

You can add your Monzo card to Google Pay if you’ve got a compatible Android phone.

1. Download the Google Pay app from the Google Play Store.
2. Follow the Google Pay app’s instructions to add your Monzo card.
3. They’ll send you a code via text to check your account, which you’ll need to enter.

That’s it! You’re ready to go.

helpArticles.question: How do I make my Monzo my default card on Apple Pay?

answer.answer: To make your Monzo card the default card used for Apple Pay transactions just open Wallet on your iPhone, touch and hold your Monzo card and then drag it to the front of your cards 💳

helpArticles.question: Removing my Monzo card from my Apple Wallet

answer.answer:
To remove your Monzo card from your Apple Wallet, please follow the steps below:

iPhone and iPad : Go to Settings > Wallet & Apple Pay, tap the card that you want to remove, then tap Remove Card.

Apple Watch: Open the Watch app on your iPhone, go to the My Watch tab, scroll down, tap Wallet & Apple Pay, tap the card, then tap Remove Card.

Mac: Go to System Preferences > Wallet & Apple Pay, click the card that you want to remove, then click the minus (–) sign to remove the card.

helpArticles.question: Does my device support Apple Pay?

answer.answer: If you have an iPhone 6 or newer then Apple Pay is supported on your device.

helpArticles.question: How to stop duplicate Apple Pay notifications

answer.answer:
Apple send notifications from the Wallet app when you use your card, but these means you'll get two notifications - one from us, and one from Apple. 

You can turn off Apple's notifications from the Wallet app 😊

Follow these steps:

1. Open Wallet
2. Tap your card
3. Tap the little "..." in the bottom right corner
4. Press "Transactions"
5. Toggle "Notifications" off
There isn't a limit for Apple Pay transactions, but some merchants might apply the contactless limit and will only accept payments of up to £30

helpArticles.question: How much can I spend using Google Pay?

answer.answer: There is no limit on Google Pay transactions, but some merchants might apply the contactless limit and will only accept payments of up to £30. Transactions made in-app are not limited.

helpArticles.question: Can I still use Google Pay if I freeze my Monzo card?

answer.answer: No, when you freeze your Monzo card it prevents any payments from being made using your card.

helpArticles.question: How do I make my Monzo card the default card?

answer.answer: Open your Google Pay app and drag your hot coral Monzo card to the front of your wallet.

You can get your salary paid into your Monzo account, and we’d love it if you did!

You’ll need to tell your employer what your new bank details are. You can find your account number and sort code in your Account screen.

Or, if you’re looking to go full Monzo, you can use the Current Account Switch Service to move everything over to us. It’s free, takes just a few minutes to set up, and we take care of all the admin for you.

__Bank transfer from another account__

Head to your Home tab and tap the ‘Add money’ button under your Monzo card (If you can't see the button, swipe down on the transactions drawer to reveal it), then tap "Bank Transfer". Make a note of your account number and sort code, then set up your Monzo account as a payee with your other bank.

Bank transfers should arrive in your account instantly, but can sometimes take longer.

__Deposit cash at a PayPoint location__

If you'd like to pay cash into your Monzo account, you can deposit cash at any of PayPoints 28,000 locations across the UK!

To deposit cash, follow these steps:

1. Find a shop displaying the PayPoint logo
2. Tell the shopkeeper you’d like to add money to your card, and how much
3. Hand over your card and the cash
4. The shopkeep will swipe your card and will return it to you with a receipt

We pass on a £1 fee for making the deposit to help us cover the costs of the service.

For example, if you deposit £10 then £9 will be added to your account around 10 minutes later. If you deposit £100, we'll add £99.

You can deposit between £5-300 in one go. And you can pay in a maximum of £1,000 every six months.

If you’re 16-17 years old, that limit is lower, so you can only deposit a maximum of £500 every six months.

__Cheques__

You can pay in cheques, but unfortunately you can't write them since we don't have cheque books. To pay in a cheque, tap the Add money button on your Account tab, or the button on this help page.

Your cheque can take up to 5-7 working days to reach us. Once we’ve received the cheque, it will take up to a week to be processed.
</br>

You can send a bank transfer to anyone with a UK bank account. You’ll need the name of the person or company you’re sending it to, and their account number and sort code. Transfers should happen instantly, but can sometimes take up to 4 hours. To send a transfer:

1. Go to your Payments tab. 
2. Tap Bank transfer and follow the instructions. 

It's worth noting that if you plan to make a transfer over £10,000 you'll need to get in touch with our team to raise your limits, and that this can take a few hours.

You can also make international transfers using our Transferwise integration, unfortunately at this point in time you can't receive international transfers into your account.

helpArticles.question: Is there a limit for cash deposits?

answer.answer:
You can deposit between £5-300 in one go, and up to £1,000 in total every six months.

If you’re 16-17 years old, that limit is lower, so you can only deposit a maximum of £500 every six months.

helpArticles.question: Why is there a limit for cash deposits?

answer.answer:
Criminals can use cash deposits for money laundering. We’ve done a few things to mitigate this already, but adding a limit helps reduce that risk even more. 

After getting feedback from customers, we think a limit of £1,000 over six months should work for most people. We'll review these limits when we have more data on how people use it 😊

helpArticles.question: My card wasn't accepted for a cash deposit

answer.answer:
Make sure your card is swiped, rather than by using the chip, contactless or typing in the number.

Some PayPoint terminals don’t have a swipe reader built in, so the shopkeeper will need to swipe your card on the till the terminal is attached to. This is the case at some Co-ops, OneStop and McColls.

If the transaction was declined you will get a notification and a declined receipt will be printed.

helpArticles.question: Why is there a fee for making a cash deposit?

answer.answer:
We don't have branches, so we need to work with another company to offer cash deposits. 

PayPoint charge us for every deposit customers make, so we’ll pass on some of these costs to help us do it in a sustainable way. 

Most other banks don’t charge for depositing cash, but there are still costs they absorb in the process and then make up elsewhere. 

We thought about doing this, but right now we want to make sure we keep it sustainable whilst delivering a feature some customers really want! 😊

helpArticles.question: What's the Direct Debit Guarantee scheme?

answer.answer: The Direct Debit guarantee applies to all banks that accept Direct Debit instructions.   If either we or the company you want to pay make a mistake with your Direct Debit, you’re entitled to a full immediate refund.

A Direct Debit lets an organisation collect a regular sum from your account. Generally, people use them for paying bills.

To set up a Direct Debit, update your bank details with the company you want to pay so they have your Monzo account number and sort code.

When you set up a Direct Debit, it’ll take at least three days to show up in your Scheduled Payments. (If you can’t see it after a week, we’d recommend getting in touch with the company you want to pay.)

To see your sort code and account number, go to the Account screen, then tap your name.

1. To cancel a Direct Debit, head to your Payments screen.
2. Tap ‘Scheduled payments’, and then pick the one you want to get rid of.
3. Tap ‘Cancel Direct Debit’, put in your PIN to confirm your ID, and you’re done. 

---
Bear in mind you’ll need to cancel a Direct Debit at least one full day before it’s due to leave your account, otherwise it might still go through. Don’t forget to let the company know you’ve cancelled, too!

We no longer accept paper standing orders. If you'd like to set up a standing order or recurring payment, you can do this in the app.

Head to the ‘Payments’ tab, on the top you should see a tab that has ‘Scheduled payments’ or just swipe left. Tap on `+` sign and enter the details of the account you want to pay to.

When you enter the amount you want to pay, remember to toggle ‘Schedule Payment’ to choose the payment date and whether it’s a recurring payment. We receive your instruction for all the payments at this point.

1. To cancel a standing order, head to the Payments tab. 2. Tap 'Scheduled payments', and then pick the one you want to get rid of. 3. Tap 'Cancel Standing Order', put in your PIN to confirm your ID, and you’re done.
Bear in mind you’ll need to cancel a standing order at least one full day before it’s due to leave your account, otherwise it might still go through. Don’t forget to let the recepient know that you’ve cancelled it too!

You can pay cheques into your Monzo account by posting them to us for free using Freepost. For higher-value cheques, you might feel more comfortable using tracked postage instead – but you don't have to 👍

__Using Freepost 📮__

1. Write your 8 digit account number on the back of the cheque in the top left corner. (To find your account number, open the Monzo app, tap the __Home__ icon in the menu bar, then tap the __Account__ button under your Monzo card. If you can't find this button, swipe down on your list of payments.)
2. Make sure the name on your cheque matches the name on your account. (To check this, open the Monzo app, tap your profile picture in the top left of the screen, tap the settings cog icon in the top right of the screen, then tap your name.)
3. Take a photo of the front and back of your cheque, as a copy.
4. Write __FREEPOST MONZO__ (nothing else!) on the envelope and post it to us. You don't need to use a stamp.
5. It'll take 2 to 3 weeks to see the money in your account. That's 7-10 days to reach us, then 4 working days to process. We'll send you an app notification when we start processing your cheque.

__Using tracked postage 🏤__

1. Follow steps 1 to 3 above 👆
2. Post your cheque to: Monzo, 6th Floor, 38 Finsbury Square, London, EC2A 1PX.
3. We'll send you an app notification when we start processing your cheque. It’ll take 4 working days from that point.

helpArticles.question: How long will my Cheque take to process?

answer.answer:
It takes 2 to 3 weeks to see the money in your account (up to 7 days to reach us by post, and 4 working days to process). We'll let you know once we're processing your cheque. 

You'll need your __8 digit account number__ written on the back of the cheque (not the envelope) for us to find your account and process it. And the name on your cheque needs to match the __legal name__ on your account. If you haven't done this, please chat to us with the details in the steps below.

__If you sent your cheque over 7 working days ago and haven't heard anything, please chat to us.__

We’ll need:

1. The date you sent it
2. Whether you sent it using freepost or tracked (if you have a tracking number, please share it)
3. The amount and currency - we can only accept cheques in UK pounds (GBP).
4. The name(s) on the cheque

We'll look through any cheques we have on hold. If we find yours, we'll process it and it'll be in your account within 4 working days.

If we can’t find it, we might ask you to get in touch with the sender to get a new cheque.

helpArticles.question: Can I pay with a Monzo cheque?

answer.answer: We do not have cheque books, so unfortunately you can’t pay with a cheque from your Monzo account.
Unfortunately, we can not accept international cheques at the moment. We’d recommend putting the cheque into another account and then transferring the money over to Monzo.

You can send money instantly to people who have Monzo through your app a couple of ways.
</br>

Head to the Payments screen, where you'll find a few different options to pay people.

__If they're nearby, try Nearby friends__

Nearby Friends lets you pay people through Bluetooth. 

1. Go to the Payments screen, and make sure you've both got Bluetooth switched on.
2. Both tap Nearby Friends, then tap your friend when their name pops up.
3. Pay away, that's it!
 
</br>
__If they're not around__

You can send a Monzo-to-Monzo payment in seconds.

1. Go to the Payments screen.
2. If it's the first time, we'll ask you to activate 'Pay with Friends' by giving the Monzo app access to your contacts. You can double check this is switched on in Settings.
3. Search for your friends' name.
4. Send money! 💸

Failing that you can also send a bank transfer from your payments screen.

You can split a bill easily with Monzo!

Go to your Monzo Home screen, then follow these taps:

1. Tap the transaction you want to split
2. Press "Split this bill"
3. Select the people you'd like to split it with
4. Press "Request Money"

You can also add people who aren't on Monzo to the bill, then ask them for the money separately. This lets you make sure everyone's share of the bill is accounted for 😊

Monzo.me lets you send and receive money without needing to know the other person’s account details. You can send money to anyone with a Monzo account through it, and __receive money from anyone__ – even if they don’t have Monzo. You can request or send money to friends and family, split a bill, chip in for a present or reimburse someone.

To send money, all you need is their Monzo.me username, which you’ll need to check with them. And you’ll need to give your Monzo.me username to anyone who wants to send you money. The money moves instantly, and it’s totally free. To use Monzo.me: 

1. Check to see that you have ‘__Payments with Friends__’ switched on in your Settings.
2. Go to the Payments tab and tap __Request__. You'll see your unique Monzo.me link which you can share. 

__Note:__ You can't use a credit card to pay someone using Monzo.me

Nearby Friends is a feature that lets you send money to other Monzo users via Bluetooth, and without the need to swap numbers or do any other admin 

Just go to the Payments tab in your app and open Nearby Friends!

For the feature to work your friend needs to have Monzo too and you both need to have Bluetooth on and 'Payments with friends' enabled in your Monzo settings. 

Make sure you're also within 30 metres of each other and on the Friends Nearby screen at the same time

If you want to send a payment to someone on Monzo, you just need to have them as a contact in your phone. You can also send money to anyone by email, text or through social media (like Facebook) without needing to know their bank details. Or you can send a regular bank transfer, for which you’ll need: - their name - their account number - their sort code
Transfers should be instant, but can take up to 2 hours (if it takes longer than the end of the next working day, please contact us in the app). To send money, head to the ‘Payments’ tab and then choose how you want to send it. If you need to share your details with somebody, you can find them in the app. If you head to the ‘Account’ tab in your app and tap your name at the top, you’ll be able to see these details. You might also need to give your bank’s address. You can use: Monzo, 38 Finsbury Square, London, UK EC2A 1PX
